intro: Tanacetum nuratavica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
